00131 cache_inode_status_t cache_inode_open( cache_entry_t              * pentry,
00132                                        cache_inode_client_t       * pclient,
00133                                        fsal_openflags_t             openflags,
00134                                        fsal_op_context_t          * pcontext,
00135                                        cache_inode_status_t       * pstatus )
00136 {
00137   fsal_status_t   fsal_status ;
00138 
00139   if( ( pentry == NULL ) || ( pclient == NULL ) || ( pcontext == NULL ) || ( pstatus == NULL ) )
00140      return CACHE_INODE_INVALID_ARGUMENT ;
00141 
00142   if( pentry->internal_md.type != REGULAR_FILE ) 
00143     {  
00144        *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_BAD_TYPE ;
00145        return *pstatus ;
00146     }
00147 
00148   if( pclient->use_cache == 0 )
00149     pentry->object.file.open_fd.last_op  = 0 ; /* to force opening the file */
00150 
00151 
00152   if( ( pclient->use_cache == 1 ) && 
00153       ( pentry->object.file.open_fd.fileno >= 0 ) &&
00154       ( time( NULL ) - pentry->object.file.open_fd.last_op  > pclient->retention ) )
00155     {
00156 #ifdef _USE_MFSL
00157       fsal_status = MFSL_close( &(pentry->object.file.open_fd.fd), &pclient->mfsl_context ) ;
00158 #else
00159       fsal_status = FSAL_close( &(pentry->object.file.open_fd.fd) ) ;
00160 #endif
00161       if( FSAL_IS_ERROR( fsal_status ) )
00162          {
00163            *pstatus = cache_inode_error_convert( fsal_status ) ;
00164 
00165            return *pstatus ;
00166          }
00167        pentry->object.file.open_fd.last_op = 0 ;
00168     }
00169 
00170 
00171   
00172   /* Open file need to be close */
00173   if( ( pentry->object.file.open_fd.openflags != 0 ) &&
00174       ( pentry->object.file.open_fd.fileno >= 0 )     &&
00175       ( pentry->object.file.open_fd.openflags != openflags ) )
00176     {
00177 #ifdef _USE_MFSL
00178       fsal_status = MFSL_close( &(pentry->object.file.open_fd.fd), &pclient->mfsl_context ) ;
00179 #else
00180       fsal_status = FSAL_close( &(pentry->object.file.open_fd.fd) ) ;
00181 #endif
00182       if( FSAL_IS_ERROR( fsal_status ) )
00183          {
00184            *pstatus = cache_inode_error_convert( fsal_status ) ;
00185 
00186            return *pstatus ;
00187          }
00188 
00189     }
00190         
00191 
00192   if( pentry->object.file.open_fd.last_op  == 0 )
00193    {
00194 #ifdef _DEBUG_FSAL
00195       printf("cache_inode_open: pentry %p: lastop=0\n", pentry);
00196 #endif
00197        
00198      /* opened file is not preserved yet */
00199 #ifdef _USE_MFSL
00200      fsal_status = MFSL_open( &(pentry->mobject),
00201                               pcontext,
00202                               &pclient->mfsl_context,
00203                               openflags,
00204                               &pentry->object.file.open_fd.fd,
00205                               &(pentry->object.file.attributes) ) ;
00206 #else
00207      fsal_status = FSAL_open( &(pentry->object.file.handle),
00208                               pcontext,
00209                               openflags,
00210                               &pentry->object.file.open_fd.fd,
00211                               &(pentry->object.file.attributes) ) ;
00212 #endif
00213 
00214      if( FSAL_IS_ERROR( fsal_status ) )
00215          {
00216            *pstatus = cache_inode_error_convert( fsal_status ) ;
00217 
00218            return *pstatus ;
00219          }
00220 
00221      pentry->object.file.open_fd.fileno    = (int)FSAL_FILENO( &(pentry->object.file.open_fd.fd) ) ; 
00222      pentry->object.file.open_fd.openflags = openflags ;
00223    }
00224 
00225    /* regular exit */
00226 
00227    pentry->object.file.open_fd.last_op = time( NULL ) ;
00228   *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ;
00229   return *pstatus ;
00230 
00231 } /* cache_content_open */

00252 cache_inode_status_t cache_inode_open_by_name( cache_entry_t              * pentry_dir,
00253                                                fsal_name_t                * pname,
00254                                                cache_entry_t              * pentry_file,
00255                                                cache_inode_client_t       * pclient,
00256                                                fsal_openflags_t             openflags,
00257                                                fsal_op_context_t          * pcontext,
00258                                                cache_inode_status_t       * pstatus )
00259 {
00260   fsal_status_t   fsal_status ;
00261   fsal_size_t     save_filesize ;
00262   fsal_size_t     save_spaceused ;
00263   fsal_time_t     save_mtime ; 
00264 
00265   if( ( pentry_dir == NULL ) || ( pname == NULL ) || ( pentry_file == NULL ) || 
00266       ( pclient == NULL ) || ( pcontext == NULL ) || ( pstatus == NULL ) )
00267      return CACHE_INODE_INVALID_ARGUMENT ;
00268 
00269   if( ( pentry_dir->internal_md.type != DIR_BEGINNING ) && ( pentry_dir->internal_md.type != DIR_CONTINUE ) )
00270     {  
00271        *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_BAD_TYPE ;
00272        return *pstatus ;
00273     }
00274 
00275   if( pentry_file->internal_md.type != REGULAR_FILE ) 
00276     {  
00277        *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_BAD_TYPE ;
00278        return *pstatus ;
00279     }
00280 
00281   if( pclient->use_cache == 0 )
00282     pentry_file->object.file.open_fd.last_op  = 0 ; /* to force opening the file */
00283 
00284   if( ( pclient->use_cache == 1 ) && 
00285       ( pentry_file->object.file.open_fd.fileno >= 0 ) &&
00286       ( time( NULL ) - pentry_file->object.file.open_fd.last_op  > pclient->retention ) )
00287     {
00288 #ifdef _USE_MFSL
00289       fsal_status = MFSL_close( &(pentry_file->object.file.open_fd.fd), &pclient->mfsl_context ) ;
00290 #else
00291       fsal_status = FSAL_close( &(pentry_file->object.file.open_fd.fd) ) ;
00292 #endif
00293       if( FSAL_IS_ERROR( fsal_status ) )
00294          {
00295            *pstatus = cache_inode_error_convert( fsal_status ) ;
00296 
00297            return *pstatus ;
00298          }
00299        pentry_file->object.file.open_fd.last_op = 0 ;
00300     }
00301 
00302   /* Open file need to be close */
00303   if( ( pentry_file->object.file.open_fd.openflags != 0 ) &&
00304       ( pentry_file->object.file.open_fd.fileno >= 0 )     &&
00305       ( pentry_file->object.file.open_fd.openflags != openflags ) )
00306     {
00307 #ifdef _USE_MFSL
00308       fsal_status = MFSL_close( &(pentry_file->object.file.open_fd.fd), &pclient->mfsl_context ) ;
00309 #else
00310       fsal_status = FSAL_close( &(pentry_file->object.file.open_fd.fd) ) ;
00311 #endif
00312       if( FSAL_IS_ERROR( fsal_status ) )
00313          {
00314            *pstatus = cache_inode_error_convert( fsal_status ) ;
00315 
00316            return *pstatus ;
00317          }
00318 
00319     }
00320        
00321   if( pentry_file->object.file.open_fd.last_op  == 0 )
00322    {
00323 #ifdef _DEBUG_FSAL
00324       printf("cache_inode_open_by_name: pentry %p: lastop=0\n", pentry_file);
00325 #endif
00326        
00327      /* Keep coherency with the cache_content */ 
00328      if( pentry_file->object.file.pentry_content != NULL ) 
00329       {
00330           save_filesize  = pentry_file->object.file.attributes.filesize ;
00331           save_spaceused = pentry_file->object.file.attributes.spaceused ;
00332           save_mtime     = pentry_file->object.file.attributes.mtime ; 
00333       }
00334 
00335      /* opened file is not preserved yet */
00336 #ifdef _USE_MFSL
00337      fsal_status = MFSL_open_by_name( &(pentry_dir->mobject),
00338                                       pname,
00339                                       pcontext,
00340                                       &pclient->mfsl_context,
00341                                       openflags,
00342                                       &pentry_file->object.file.open_fd.fd,
00343                                       &(pentry_file->object.file.attributes) ) ;
00344 #else
00345      fsal_status = FSAL_open_by_name( &(pentry_dir->object.file.handle),
00346                                       pname,
00347                                       pcontext,
00348                                       openflags,
00349                                       &pentry_file->object.file.open_fd.fd,
00350                                       &(pentry_file->object.file.attributes) ) ;
00351 #endif
00352 
00353      if( FSAL_IS_ERROR( fsal_status ) )
00354          {
00355            *pstatus = cache_inode_error_convert( fsal_status ) ;
00356 
00357            return *pstatus ;
00358          }
00359 
00360 #ifdef _USE_PROXY
00361 
00362      /* If proxy if used, we should keep the name of the file to do FSAL_rcp if needed */
00363      if( ( pentry_file->object.file.pname = (fsal_name_t *)Mem_Alloc( sizeof( fsal_name_t ) ) ) == NULL )
00364         {
00365            *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_MALLOC_ERROR ;
00366         
00367             return *pstatus ;
00368         }
00369 
00370      pentry_file->object.file.pentry_parent_open = pentry_dir ;
00371      pentry_file->object.file.pname->len = pname->len ;
00372      memcpy( (char *)(pentry_file->object.file.pname->name), (char *)(pname->name), FSAL_MAX_NAME_LEN ) ;
00373      
00374 #endif
00375 
00376      /* Keep coherency with the cache_content */ 
00377      if( pentry_file->object.file.pentry_content != NULL ) 
00378       {
00379           pentry_file->object.file.attributes.filesize  = save_filesize ;
00380           pentry_file->object.file.attributes.spaceused = save_spaceused ;
00381           pentry_file->object.file.attributes.mtime     = save_mtime; 
00382       }
00383 
00384      pentry_file->object.file.open_fd.fileno    = (int)FSAL_FILENO( &(pentry_file->object.file.open_fd.fd) ) ; 
00385      pentry_file->object.file.open_fd.openflags = openflags ;
00386      
00387 #ifdef _DEBUG_FSAL
00388      printf("cache_inode_open_by_name: pentry %p: fd=%u\n", pentry_file, pentry_file->object.file.open_fd.fileno);     
00389 #endif
00390      
00391    }
00392 
00393    /* regular exit */
00394    pentry_file->object.file.open_fd.last_op = time( NULL ) ;
00395   *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ;
00396   return *pstatus ;
00397 
00398 } /* cache_inode_open_by_name */

00401 
00418 cache_inode_status_t cache_inode_close( cache_entry_t         * pentry,
00419                                         cache_inode_client_t  * pclient,
00420                                         cache_inode_status_t  * pstatus )
00421 {
00422   fsal_status_t fsal_status ;
00423 
00424   if( ( pentry == NULL ) || ( pclient == NULL ) || ( pstatus == NULL ) )
00425      return CACHE_CONTENT_INVALID_ARGUMENT ;
00426 
00427   if( pentry->internal_md.type != REGULAR_FILE ) 
00428     {  
00429        *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_BAD_TYPE ;
00430        return *pstatus ;
00431     }
00432 
00433   /* if nothing is opened, do nothing */
00434   if(  pentry->object.file.open_fd.fileno < 0 )
00435    {
00436      *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ;
00437      return *pstatus ;
00438    }
00439 
00440   if( ( pclient->use_cache == 0 ) ||
00441       ( time( NULL) - pentry->object.file.open_fd.last_op > pclient->retention ) || 
00442       ( pentry->object.file.open_fd.fileno > (int)(pclient->max_fd_per_thread) ) )
00443    {
00444      pentry->object.file.open_fd.fileno  = -1 ;
00445      pentry->object.file.open_fd.last_op =  0 ;
00446 
00447 #ifdef _USE_MFSL
00448      fsal_status = MFSL_close( &(pentry->object.file.open_fd.fd), &pclient->mfsl_context ) ;
00449 #else
00450      fsal_status = FSAL_close( &(pentry->object.file.open_fd.fd) ) ;
00451 #endif
00452      if( FSAL_IS_ERROR( fsal_status ) )
00453          {
00454            *pstatus = cache_inode_error_convert( fsal_status ) ;
00455 
00456            return *pstatus ;
00457          }
00458    }
00459 
00460 #ifdef _USE_PROXY
00461   /* If proxy if used, free the name if needed */
00462   if( pentry->object.file.pname != NULL )
00463     {
00464        Mem_Free( (char *)( pentry->object.file.pname ) ) ;
00465        pentry->object.file.pname = NULL ;
00466     }
00467   pentry->object.file.pentry_parent_open = NULL ;
00468 #endif
00469 
00470   *pstatus = CACHE_CONTENT_SUCCESS ;
00471 
00472   return *pstatus ;
00473 } /* cache_content_close */
